name: Web Archive
summary: Learn about .WARC files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: The Web ARChive, or WARC, format is an extension of the Internet Archive .ARC format. The primary difference between WARC and ARC files is that WARC files can include metadata about when and how the data they contain was archived (e.g., what program created the archive).
WARC is the standard format in which internet archivists save archived webpages. However, you may encounter web archives saved in other formats, including the ARC and .WACZ formats.
NOTE: WARC files compressed with gzip compression use the .warc.gz extension.

instructions: You can open a WARC file with Webrecorder Player (multiplatform) or Webrecorder ReplayWeb.page (Web). Doing so will allow you to view the archived content the WARC file contains.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
